如果没记错的话应该是慈善包里入的
我以为是跟画风一样软萌软萌的小游戏[spoiler]实际上，卧槽，真他妈难[/spoiler]
由于没能通关，评测可能有一定的片面性

+我只打到2-16，看选关界面，应该是有五大章，每章20关，挺良心
+第二章的时候已经有4种敌人，跳台，踏板，尖刺等，看指南说后期还有雾天，会跟踪的子弹等等，内容非常丰富
+bgm挺多的好像，挺耐听，没那么魔性
+游戏内置排行榜，具体到每关，全球，自己，好友

~硬核游戏，难度直线上升，每关不算长，虽然也是一击必死，但像苹果那种的都需要卡时间打，苹果落地就输，容错率特别低
~无中文，游戏是日语英语混杂的，不过没啥需要理解的，上手容易精通难

-暂时没找到明显的缺点，非要说的话可能就是弓箭手感太随意了吧，像水枪一样……不过也算降低难度了

游戏画风与难度完全不是一个档次……通关预估3个小时左右，应该不至于太长，每关都可以背板。8折就可以入，当练反应及预判了。
引用一句评测：
[quote=Mister Franz] it's like SAS training for Asian kids[/quote]

总评：7/10

40578922.review: Truly a game made for a very specific demographic, which I am not a part of. Lovely Planet is a very peculiar First Person Shooter. The game is designed for speedrunners, everything’s fast, floaty, and among the cell shaded abstract world, disorienting. Despite necessary precision, there’s no aiming reticule. Each level has three stars, a completion star, a 100% accuracy star, and a speed star. There’s no story, there’s only completion and leaderboards. If that sort of high-skill/high-time requirement competition thing is your style, then this might be up your alley. But for the most part, I can’t recommend this, it’s too niche.

40032826.review:
Fast, fresh, inventive and different. I have barely played an hour, and already I feel like this deserves my warmest recommendation. I am *not* really into FPS games, normally - especially not competetive multiplayer ones like CS:GO, the BF-titles etc. Perhaps that is exactly why this game spoke to me. It plays more like Hotline Miami than any CoD-game, and the sparse gallery of gameplay-elements are very inventive and fits perfectly into the tone and pace.

This is a game of practicing the same sequence of dodges and shots, until you get it right - much like in fast-paced platform games. It is the kind of game that encourages you to rush through, practice your routines, and - when you eventually get it right - awards you with a nice sense of acomplishemtn. Some of the elements are outright brilliant. ...such as the bombs, that are tossed at you like agressive clay pigeons, and have to be shot down before they touch the ground - those add a great deal of momentum to your play.

Be aware that the game is not for everyone. I suspect that more traditional FPS-fans would dislike it, due to some glaring genre-convension-defying issues. While I loved every second of Lovely Planet, it also felt like it was trying to be different, just for the sake of being different. I do not agree with the decition not to have a crosshair. I felt that the scoreboards and speed-run-aspect were unneccecary, and I would have gladly changed them for a bit more visual polish. The game achieves a lot with its simple art style, but at times it comes across as a bit too lazy.. Seeing as nothing has textures, distances become harder to judge, and this hurts the game in places where it also chooses to use a lot of round shapes of varying sizes, and where it chooses to shrink things instead of having a death-animation ...which is literally in every other scene.

That being said, the level design is pretty great, the game is clean and self-exlainatory, and the pacing of things is splendid - so I can certainly learn to live with its faults. Recommended at full prize, if you're into fast-paced short-cycled arcade-fun and weird artsy shit.

39948193.review:
みんなー！対人FPSで撃ち勝てなくてイライラしちゃってるー？
AIMが悪くて当たらなくてつらいー？ 
それならLovelyPlanetで癒やされよう！
きれいな空、柔らかい曲線で描かれた世界、四角と三角のキャラクター達、空飛ぶりんご
Lovely Planetの世界で荒んだ心を休めよう

と言うとでも思ったか
このゲームはそんな生ぬるいものではない
兵士育成用訓練プログラムだ。

[h1]飛んで、走って、撃つ。[/h1]

このシンプルな動きだけで構成されたこのゲームは瞬間的に「どの敵を優先的に撃つか」、「どのポイントに移動すれば効率よく移動できるか」を判断しつつ丁寧なAIMで一つずつ射撃をすることを要求される。
一本道だから走るルートはすぐに理解できるだろう。もちろん、クリア不可能な難易度ではない。

[h1]より早く、より正確に[/h1]

一度クリアしたステージであっても、タイムを縮め、ルートを最適化し、そして一発で当てることを意識して反復を繰り返す。
星３つの評価を得るために…

おそらくこのゲームを完全に理解する頃にはあなたは　立派な兵士になっていることでしょう。

39899490.review: The last two worlds of this game are hard as fuck. Like harder than than the tinman's dick. And you will fail at every level at least 20 times before you get it right. And you'll scream and you'll cuss at it and you'll hate it. But once you finally nail that apple out in the distant fog you never thought you could nail and you get to that textureless, magenta pole at the end and you see your abysmal time compared to the superhumans who ranked in the top 13 or so in the leaderboards, it'll all be worth it. If you can beat this game, you are a god among men. It's strange, the menu is terrible, the graphics get sickening to look at, but it will turn you into something of a machine. Or rather, it will synchronize with some machine part of you that you did not know was there. See, It gives you no crosshair. You get an intuitive sense of where you're going to shoot and you get an intuitive sense of where the bullets will eventually land. Not unheard of in other FPS games, but you can almost predict every frame before it happens. You will develop such an integration with the mechanics of this game that you can sense with one slightly off tap of the spacebar if you've just ruined your shot at beating the level. You can feel the purple blocks which track you encroaching. You can feel if you've got no time to shoot them before they inevitably whack you, and send you right back. You get a twinge of nausea when you heard the apple drop. Don't buy this game if you're looking for a casual shooter. It has a cozy appearance but I believe in some way it has physically altered my brain. I see it in my head when as I try to sleep. Instead of those strange short dreams of slipping right before you go to sleep -- you know the ones you get where you're just about to doze off but you picture yourself slipping and feel that pang of adrenaline and your eyes open and you lay awake with your eyes open, half asleep, half heart pounding? -- instead of those, I see purple blocks slowly encroaching, with just too little time to quickly aim and shoot. I hear apples dropping.

38191770.review:
Overall, I like this game. It has its problems. There are definitely situations where it's not very clear what the direction the game wants you to go in -- and because certain things you need to shoot aren't activated unless you follow the desired path, it can make thinking outside of the box a bit annoying.

That said, it controls well and the concept is fun. 

I think the main thing that hurts it right now are the leaderboards. There are some very obvious cheaters on there. I mean, one guy has multiple negative times. Considering this is a game about speed, leaderboards seem like something that would be important to its enjoyment. Until these cheaters are removed, it kind of hampers the game.

37709848.review:
Lovely Planet bases itself around level design that builds upon itself introducing mechanics at good pacing, while constantly challenging the player's reflexes and wit to get through levels as fast as possible while kicking it to a god-tier soundtrack. The game constantly spews character and cheerful vibes that mitigate frustrations and enhances the brutal giddiness with every sound effect, enemy placement, and aesthetic choice.

If you like a challenge, if you want an experience that can be experienced in short bursts whenever you want, or if you enjoy first person arcade-like shooter platformers, then I recommend this game, especially if you're into japanese chip-tune music.

Issa good game.

Empiezas el juego tonteando y hasta planteandote dejarlo por aburrimiento, pero si eres alguien con ansias de completar todos los logros y le das una oportunidad de jugarlo en serio y más de 15 minutos... me alegra poder decirte que... has caido en la trampa.

Las pantallas tienen una progresion discordante en cuanto al cástigo de tus fallos. Puede que las 2 primeras fases del mundo 4 las completes sin problemas, la 3 y la 4 castigarte duramente si intentas conseguir todas las estrellas y la 5 puede no darte margen de error ninguno o todo lo contrario. Tal vez sea para que no termines rindiendote o que te de un ataque cardíaco por la mala leche.

Es un juego que amarás u odiarás pero que es poco probable que te deje indiferente (si lo juegas en serio claro).

36949688.review:
I didn't really know what to expect when I played this game, but I'm glad I gave it a try.
Colourful visuals and peaceful/cheerful music brighten up what is a hardcore and difficult shooting game. The objective being killing all the bad guys in a level before exiting, with a few other mechanics to keep you moving. Alongside bonuses for going fast with 100% accuracy and the inclusion of leaderboards, you could be playing levels over and over again.
The difficulty spikes really high halfway through the game, which really bothered me as I played. First thing I'm going through levels quickly and next thing I know there's some ridiculous shots that need to be made to progress. It might throw off some players and the difficulty spike is really that noticeable.

Overall, it's a fun hardcore arcade shooter with nice visuals and sounds. Just be prepared to play some ridiculous levels near the end.

If there was a dictionary entry titled "100% no-bullsh*t skill based shooter," it would feature pictures of this game.

Lovely Planet is a delightfully difficult shooter with cutesy graphics that belie the challenges it presents. Were it not for the infectiously catchy and upbeat music, I would probably have torn half my hair out by this point, but that is not to say that the game is infuriatingly difficult or that at any point during my playtime I felt that it had cheated me, just that it is definitely  very hard. If you're like me and feel compelled to replay levels until you obtain that precious 3-star rating, get ready for an emotional rollercoaster you'll never want to get off.

Welp I'm done. I'm good. This is...frustrating. Like, I enjoy a good challenge but this game just got frustrating. So much trial and error and the shooting just feels odd. Como con una gran mayoría de juegos, no me esperaba nada de Lovely Planet, pero este juego es atrevido y joder, funciona.

[u]¿Por que me encanta Lovely Planet?[/u]
[list]
[*] Pura geometría, formas básicas y comprensibles.
[*] La paleta de colores tan viva y agradable que utiliza.
[*] La banda sonora representa muy fielmente la palabra 'kawaii' y le da ese toque distintivo.
[*] Es básicamente un juego de disparos en primera persona (FPS) pero todo combina tan bien que simplemente funciona y es entretenido, simple y jugoso.
[*] El reto que supone, y como va escalando la dificultad del juego a medida que pasas niveles, hasta el punto de llegar a odiarlo y amarlo a la vez.
[/list]

Desde luego un gran juego para pasar el rato, descubrir algo nuevo, original y distintivo a un precio razonable.

34180216.review:
First person shooter meets jump and run at 600 FPS. A Review by [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/29892929]The Casually Addicted Gamer[/url]

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Lovely Planet is made with low-poly models, which enables high frame rates and fluent gameplay on older computers. The goal is to run against a pole at the other side of the level. On your way, you got to shoot red enemies which will start firing at you once they see you, avoid red balls and mind the gap when jumping onto other platforms. The difficulty with shooting is that at some point you will be challenged by falling objects, which need to be shot before reaching the ground, and by enemies standing behing every corner or between some hostages, which must not be shot, all at the same time,

[h1]Controls[/h1]
W/A/S/D keys are used by default to walk, and the Space key for jumping, both at a blazingly fast speed. R is being used to restart a level. Lovely Planet does not show any crosshair, but this is totally fine as aiming is not a priority in this game. The Menu seems to be only partly in English, but once a level is loaded, you can quickly switch through the available levels using the Tab key.

[h1]Atmosphere and Appearance[/h1]
By being decorated everywhere with hearts and providing music focused on improving concentration, this game appears cute and happy enough to be frustration-free.
As each level provides Highscore lists, you can compare yourself to others by the time you needed to complete the level. You'll just have to ignore the ridiculous entries by people claiming to have completed a level in 0.01 seconds or even in -9999 seconds.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Lovely planet is one of the cutest shooters in Steam and runs on every potato computer. For a fair price of $5.99. It can be played casually but definitely got the potential to make you play it for much longer than planned.
[b]Remember:[/b]There's no such thing as a multiplayer mode.

To be fair, you have to have a very high IQ to understand Rick and Morty. The humour is extremely subtle, and without a solid grasp of theoretical physics most of the jokes will go over a typical viewer’s head. There’s also Rick’s nihilistic outlook, which is deftly woven into his characterisation- his personal philosophy draws heavily from Narodnaya Volya literature, for instance. The fans understand this stuff; they have the intellectual capacity to truly appreciate the depths of these jokes, to realise that they’re not just funny- they say something deep about LIFE. As a consequence people who dislike Rick & Morty truly ARE idiots- of course they wouldn’t appreciate, for instance, the humour in Rick’s existential catchphrase “Wubba Lubba Dub Dub,” which itself is a cryptic reference to Turgenev’s Russian epic Fathers and Sons. I’m smirking right now just imagining one of those addlepated simpletons scratching their heads in confusion as Dan Harmon’s genius wit unfolds itself on their television screens. What fools.. how I pity them. 😂

And yes, by the way, i DO have a Rick & Morty tattoo. And no, you cannot see it. It’s for the ladies’ eyes only- and even then they have to demonstrate that they’re within 5 IQ points of my own (preferably lower) beforehand. Nothin personnel kid 😎

31515176.review:
Looks like a cute anime game, right? Wrong.

Lovely Planet, despite looking like a nice, child friendly game, is hellishly difficult. It takes pro Counter-Strike players, swallows them whole, and shits them out as a shell of their former self. Casuals should just leave now, go find something else to play, there's nothing for you here.

Lovely Planet has a great, soothing, fun soundtrack; this was a nice design choice to help prevent players from raging, because you will die, a lot. Tight controls, mixed with lightning fast gameplay make for a high skill ceiling, and you'll nearly need to reach that ceiling just to 100% the game, let alone COMPETE on the leaderboards.

There are 100 levels, each one containing 3 obtainable stars:
-1 star is given for completing the level, usually pretty easy, but sometimes can still be painful.
-1 star is given for beating the par time on a level, in the earlier levels you could be a complete numbskull and still get par time, but on some of the later levels you will need nearly frame-perfect play.
-1 star is awarded for having 100% accuracy, if you've got an itchy trigger finger just forget it, you won't get this star. You'll need to snipe falling targets from hundreds of feet away while flying through the air yourself, and remember, miss even one bullet and you won't get the star.

Easily the Dark Souls of FPS games, and in my opinion, Lovely Planet is the Dark Souls 3 that we all wanted but FromSoft didn't deliver.

10/10, no contest, no memes.

Lovely Planet es un FPS que nos sitúa en un mundo de fantasía muy colorido y, a primera vista, adorable. También de primeras parece asequible en su dificultad. Pero ahí se queda, en una primera impresión, porque es un shooter jodidamente difícil (y adictivo).

Consta de 5 mundos con en torno a 20 fases o mapas (por mundo) muy cortos, de 10-30 seg la mayoría, en los cuales deberemos saltar (tiene un poco de plataformas), disparar o esquivar como posesos. Cada vez que mueras deberás empezar la fase desde el principio. Algunas requieren una destreza o habilidad (y velocidad) con el ratón increíble. La dificultad es bastante progresiva: el primer mundo es asequible, el segundo tiene cierta dificultad, el tercero es difícil, el cuarto es muy difícil y el quinto...buena suerte con el quinto (y paciencia). Lo amarás y lo odiarás.

Mención especial merece su banda sonora que, sinceramente, es inmejorable (al menos para este tipo de juego con tal frenesí). De las mejores OST de videojuego que he oído en mi vida.

Para cualquier amante de los FPS debería ser un imprescindible.

31010766.review:
Lovely Planet is a first person shooter. Only much more than a first person shooter.
In this game, you run and gun your way through a simplistic, abstract, and cute world, clearing stages of baddies as you dash for the goal. It doesn't sound like much, but there's a lot more to it than just running and gunning: You have platforming to do, gimmicks to use/overcome, baddies waiting around corners and behind walls ready to shoot you, and one challenging road ahead of you.
And this game is indeed challenging. While, like most games, this game starts out pretty easy, you'll eventually be jumping from platform to platform while shooting down baddies at the same time. Some levels may take you many tries, but I found it impossible to get mad at a game like this with super tight controls for a 3D platformer, a responsive, "fires as fast as you can pull the trigger" semi-automatic... gun... thing... simplistic but nice looking levels, and fast-paced action, all with a super upbeat and energizing soundtrack as the cherry on top.
Even if it's just 5 worlds, it's a blast to playthrough, and it's even more fun going back to levels you've completed to beat your previous times and find secrets. Not to mention after you learn the levels you'll eventually master them and become a gun-slinging speed demon. It's worth the $6, and can be a good time killer, or just something to do if you don't have any other AAA games to be getting to.

30715172.review:
Ho trovato questo gioco in un bundle e l'ho attivato solo perché aveva molte recensioni positive e perché mi piacciono gli FPS, ma la delusione è avvenuta dopo pochi minuti di gioco.

E' un gioco molto snello (poche decine di MB) nonostante sia fatto in Unity (molti sviluppatori si dimenticano di ottimizzare i file di dati e lasciano spesso gigabyte di spazzatura fra gli asset).
La grafica è fumettosa ma sembrava meglio sugli screenshot, mentre durante il gioco perde molto. In genere è il contrario, anche con giochi molto moderni ed AAA, ma qui non c'è solo la semplicità della grafica, c'è anche la quasi totale assenza di animazioni ed eye-candy, senza parlare di una certa legnosità del controllo del nostro personaggio, sia durante lo spostamento, che durante il fuoco che durante i salti. Il tutto mostra l'anima super indie di questo gioco, ma anche uno scarso impegno da parte dello sviluppatore.

Il gioco in sé è uno sparatutto a livelli, 10 (se non sbaglio) per ogni mondo, in cui lo scopo è quello di arrivare alla fine senza morire. Mi sembra che si debbano anche uccidere tutti i nemici altrimenti il livello successivo non si sblocca, ma ci ho giocato talmente poco che non ricordo.
Il tutto è portato all'estremo molto velocemente, ed infatti questo gioco è stato fatto principalmente per chi vuole un gioco “da classifica”. Pensate ad un Super Meat Boy in 3D, dove la precisione e la velocità di completamento di ogni livello vi darà un punteggio più alto, ed alla fine vi sarà mostrata una classifica dove vedere la vostra posizione. Questa funzione utilizza Steam, quindi avrete la possibilità di filtrare per amici, globale o vicino a voi, ma significa anche che chiunque può barare e nessuno gli toglierà mai il punteggio dalla classifica.

Appena ho notato che il gioco andava verso questa direzione ho deciso di andare a leggere alcune recensioni negative, per sapere se mi stavo sbagliando, ma ho trovato una situazione ancora peggiore. In effetti non solo il gioco diventa molto difficile, ma difficile in un modo stupido e che io non condivido, e cioè talmente complesso che dovrete imparare i livelli a memoria solo per non morire, mentre fino al mondo 3 vi serviva di impararli solo se volevate fare punteggi alti.
C'è una cosa in particolare che tutti hanno odiato, e cioè la “mela che cade”: a partire già dal primo mondo, ad un certo punto del livello ci sarà questa specie di mela che cadrà verso di voi e dovrete colpirla (il vostro attacco è una lenta freccia che rende il tutto ancora più difficile) prima che tocchi il suolo, pena la morte immediata (il vostro personaggio ha solo una vita e nessuna energia, morirete al primo colpo). Nei mondi successivi, tuttavia, questa mela cadrà in parti del livello che non riuscirete a vedere per via della nebbia (e non verso di voi), che necessiterà che spariate a caso fino a che capirete dove questa mela cade, e come fare per colpirla prima che tocchi terra, e questo per tutte le mele di ogni livello, a volte più di una contemporaneamente!
Vi risparmio tutte le altre amenità che sono state inserite per rendere i livelli difficili, perché non si tratta solo di mele, ma vi ho voluto raccontare di quel “nemico” in particolare perché sembra sia il principale motivo che ha fatto mollare il gioco ai giocatori. A me è bastata la noia, perché anche se non avesse avuto questi problemi, sarebbe comunque stato una perdita di tempo ed una noia mortale.

Insomma uno di quei giochi fatti male, difficili perché artificialmente difficili (il modo più semplice per rendere un gioco difficile), e che dovrete provare e riprovare, imparare a memoria, spendere ore della vostra vita per ottenere solo un punteggio su una classifica che non importa a nessuno, e che può essere hackerata facilmente.

Questi sviluppatori con talmente poche idee e capacità che devono abbassarsi ad usare questi mezzucci per vantarsi di aver fatto un gioco difficile dovrebbero cambiare lavoro, perché è evidente che non hanno idea di cosa significhi rendere un gioco difficile ma onestamente e con creatività.

Molto meglio giocare a Serious Sam a difficoltà elevata piuttosto che giochi come questo, almeno lì, se muoio, la colpa è mia, e non del gioco.

30392541.review:
Fun little game a little too far up the difficulty curve for me. 

Lovely planet is a great collection of first-person shooter short run levels. You're timed and accuracy counts. I don't know the correct terms but its comparable to a rythm runner but as a first-person shooter. Or something. Its fun! Fairly minimalist, the game runs smooth and gets the most important thing right; input. There's nothing clunky about the controls, no input lag, no jerks, nothing. Just smooth and satisfying gameplay. While simple in concept the enemies/targets do get progressively harder to time and more difficult to hit. There's a heavy emphasis on speedrunning and perfection which I was personally never going to go after but may be the main appeal for many. I figured I could find enough fun in just plain beating the levels without perfection or record times. But I'm about halfway through World 4 (of 5) and I've hit the limits of my patience. The last level I beat took easily 50, if not 100, attempts. Which doesn't seem like a lot when you consider a level length is usually under 15 seconds. But the reverse of that means your 50 deaths are piling up every 5 seconds. It wears you down. It is satisfying to finally conquer a level though! The game is fair and when you get it right its because you darn well got it right. Luck isn't involved and I think that's important in a fair game of this ilk. Still, I got maybe a few more tries left in me but I just don't have that so-called "quick twitch shooter" capability in me to make it a feasible prospect to finish with my few shreds of remaining sanity intact. While I won't be likely to complete the game I certainly had fun getting to where I have. And, though against my normal personal review requirements, feel I got enough of what I wanted from the game to form an opinion worth sharing. 

I got it in a bundle which was perfect. Its worth the price:time to check out bundled for sure. And to the speedrunning and quick twitch first-person shooter inclined player? It just may be classic stuff worth much more. I had some fun even without the perfect runs, speedrunning, or admittedly even finishing it. Softly recommended.

29142161.review:
I love this game. It is as the name entails, absolutely lovely. 

You play in a FPS perspective, running and jumping across different worlds shooting baddies with a star-gun while avoiding obstacles and enemy projectiles. You can get 3 stars on each level for completing the level under a certain time and without missing a single shot at the same time. 

Graphics are very simplistic and pleasing to the eye with light colors and smooth shapes. 
The music is very catchy, energetic and cheery and has a kind of "Lets go!" feel to it. It is made by the artist Calum Bowen and can be bought at bandcamp.com. 
The dificulty of the game itself becomes high but eases the player into the controls at the beginning. Any obstacle the player will meet are introduced in a good way as to not make the game seem unfair or unpredictable. 

If you like a good fps challange I definitely recommend this game as a very relaxing and happy game to play.

29001492.review:
Each level is a short segment that you're meant to play a few times before you clear it (or maybe a few dozen times in the last couple worlds) similar to super meat boy. Respawning is near instant when you die so it's not frustrating at all. It's a first person version of a precision platformer. Once you beat the game you can attempt to get 3 stars on every level, which basically makes each level a completely new challenge. There's a huge difference between simply beating a level and putting in the time and effort to optimize and perfect it.

This game will occasionally frustrate you with it's hard one hit kills and frankly absurd trickshots, but it's impossible to stay angry for more than a fraction of a second as it thrusts you straight back into the action as a jolly tune plays and you dash over a field of lovehearts.

This is a game for the hardcore FPS players, if you like quake this is literally the game for you. But on a more deep level it really is for that FPS player, it's a great game that lets you unwind, instead of punishment for failure you get whimsy and a bright bubbly soundtrack.

If you're frustrated with your teammates in TF2 or Overwatch, play this game.
If you love playing Doom, Quake or Unreal tournament, play this game.
If you like unexplained japanese writings and weird shit このゲイムを遊ぶ。
If you like speedrunning (or you're interested in getting into it) play this game.

28543282.review:
As a fan of these faster-paced/speedrun twitch-based games, Lovely Planet was a pleasant surpirse to play.  Some parts of the game were a little vague and confusing at first (especially the apples and some of the creatures around), but it becomes completely understandable after dying a few times.  The controls are so smooth and I love the jump, everything flows together well.  There are multiple routes to most of the levels and you need perfect accuracy and pathing to get three stars on each of the levels (star-based grading system - one star for completion, one star for beating it in under a certain amount of time, and the third star for having 100% accuracy), giving the game some good replay-value and keeping the levels challenging and fun.  The levels aren't long enough for them to get annoying to play over, with most of the levels (only up to world 4 so I can't speak for the rest) taking up to 40 seconds or so at the longest.  

Great game with visuals reminiscient of the Katamari Damacy, I'd definitely recommend it for anyone looking for a good challenge.

28119863.review:
Do not be deceived, Lovely Planet is not for little babby as its aesthetic may imply. Lovely Planet is a true teeth-gritting experience. It may be more apt to call this a puzzle-shooter than anything else, in my opinion. Lovely Planet wants perfection out of you, and it won't settle for anything less than that. 

The formula per level is simple: shoot all baddies and reach the big pink pole at the end of the map. Simple, right? Well it certainly starts off simple. Soon you'll move up from just shooting stationary baddies to shooting apples out of the air to shooting the baddies' projectiles out of the air to... I'm not too sure what comes after that. Haven't made it past world 3 yet cuz this game is *pretty challenging*.

If you're a fan of games like Super Meat Boy, you'll enjoy this. If you prefer games that give you options on how to complete a level, this may not be for you. Overall it's a challenging experience and will really test your FPS skills.

27761071.review:
I got this game for free. Basically some guy set me 25 games and in return I sent him the cards you get from the games. Out of the 25 games he sent me, this is the only one I didn't uninstall. The game is simple, yet entertaining. A unique parkour game has you jumping on platforms and quickly shooting things from a distance to maintain your character alive. There are some levels that require you to shoot at enemies shooting at you, other levels have you shooting the platforms you are jumping from, trying to shoot the hazards without hitting the platform itself and falling, and my favorite kind of levels have you shooting at shells being shot out of a mortar before they hit the ground and expload, sometimes 3 or 4 on the screen at once requiring quick thinking.

Pros
-Quick, easy to get in and out of
-Challanging enough but not extremely difficult
-If a level is too hard for you, there is an option to move to the next one and come back later
-If the game is too easy, you can skip to the later levels right from the start, (There is no linear flow of levels)
-Nice graphics are very easy on the eyes
-Some cleverly hidden secrets that are fun too look for
-Responsive controls, the game plays like any fps game, but you have a bow and arrow instead of a gun, and looking around feels more graceful

Cons
-No music (But that's not too big of a deal)
-No limit to how many times you can shoot. This is a con because it makes the game too easy at some times. It would have been nice if there was a difficulty that limited the shots per level, but its not that big of a deal. Its fun to challenge yourself to hit the mortar shells in one try.

27753588.review: If you are bored of a game for the day, I go to this game. Regardless of whether you beat the levels, this game makes you feel like you are actually in it. Amazing original sound track as well. This game would be featured if it were compatible with Steam VR.

27028345.review:
Lovely Planet is without a doubt the hardest game I've ever beaten, but i did beat it and it was an absolute joy to play. The music and artstyle are great and memorable. The difficulty makes it incredibly addicting and I couldn't put it down until I beat the level I was stuck on. It never feels unfair, though some parts may feel like they are beyond your skill level. However with enough practice you can always get past them, and the early levels that seemed too hard at first are a breeze after completing later worlds.
There's lots of replayability, there are many secrets to be found in each world if you look hard enough. Also, you can 3-star every level by beating it within a time limit and with 100% accuracy.
The bright atmosphere and bubbly music make it genuinely pleasant to play, even when you get frustrated.
Overall Lovely Planet is just way too fun to pass up. Try the demo and see if you like the reflex-based gameplay style, just keep in mind that it gets 1000x harder than those first few levels. Also do yourself a favor and turn mouse sensitivity up.

26528160.review:
一款看上去非常“有趣”的游戏，至少在朋友安利的时候我是这么认为的。

简单明了的操作方式，节奏欢快的BGM，一进游戏就被深深的吸引，然而随着关卡的逐步推进我才清楚地了解到在这个可爱清新的外表之下，到底蕴含了制作组何等洪水猛兽般的恶意（笑
单纯想要通关和追求全收集成就的话，难度还算适中，但这也是建立在玩家一定程度FPS能力的基础之上，如果要挑战全部关卡三星评价的话，那么难度立马上升到地狱级别。

游戏内三星的要求是：
1.顺利抵达终点
2.一定时间内抵达终点
3.弹无虚发（每次射击必须击中一个目标）
要达成这三个目标需要对关卡地图的绝对熟悉以及对射击时机的绝对把握，难度可以说鬼畜的一塌糊涂。

如果有FPS游戏基础且喜欢挑战自我的玩家，那么这个游戏就是对你的最佳试炼。

PS:游戏OST很不错，值得入一份。

26122884.review:
Lovely Planet....

With those dainty graphics, happy music and that cutesy title you'd be forgiven for thinking this will be a fun, undemanding distraction of a game that you might unwind to at the end of a hard days work. 

Oh no....

What You get instead:

 - short, sharp, super hard levels that only get progressively harder, 
 - endless deaths, 
 - infinite, rapid-fire respawns
 - very tricky-to-achieve rewards

Very roughly speaking, Lovely Planet plays like a 3D Super Meatboy: devilishly difficult, very frustrating, yet has that "one more try" factor, pulling you back for more punishment. 

Frustratingly hard but very rewarding, this is highly recommended.

26065074.review:
Очень часто мы видим, как разработчики пытаются совместить несколько жанров в одной игре. Так попытались сделать некие безызвестные индусские девелоперы, совместив жанр шутера от первого лица и платформера. Получилась Lovely Planet. Игра, несмотря на первый взгляд, является ОЧЕНЬ сложной, но в то же время вполне увлекательной и интересной. В ней всего 5 миров, в каждом из которых 22 уровня. С каждым миром добавляется новая механика, которая, естественно, лишь усложняет процесс игры. Нужно иметь массу упорства и терпения, чтобы пройти ее до конца. Но все же заценить игру чрезвычайно советую.

[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

Lovely Planet is a game developed by QUICKTEQUILA and published by tinyBuild Games. You jump high, you run very fast, and every shot has to be calculated. The game comes down to, shoot every red thing, avoid hitting the blue things and then touch the exit

The developer does a really good job of working with these simple rules into making a really fun game. Later on you can encounter other enemies that can shoot at you as well as some other things I won't say in this review

The gun works in an interesting way, there is no crosshair provided on screen, the gun is effected by the player's momentum and you do not shoot straight, but one you get the hang of it you feel really cool after you complete a level

Lovely Planet is a fun, challenging game that can be played in short bursts of Japanese goodness (see what I did there?)

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

The feel is incredibly surreal and hilariously upbeat. I imagine it's what you'd feel like if you combined LSD and cocaine.

It's a great casual game if you need to kill a few minutes - the levels that I've played are very short, less than 20s start to finish. 

It's one of those platformers that you *could* take one obstacle at a time, but it just feels so so sleek and satisfying when you never stop moving, flick-airshotting projectiles while cleverly strafing a deadly red blob as you jump to the next platform. You'll finish a level with your blood pumping and with a huge sense of satisfaction.

25235126.review:
Before the review, let me state that this was my first owned FPS on PC.  Getting used to the keyboard/mouse controls having some FPS background in consoles but none in PC was difficult but managable.  This says a lot about the difficulty and how brilliant it is.

This game has no forced tutorial but theres really only 4 things you have to know: move, aim, jump, shoot.

Up until a level in area 2 (Village), you start to realize that the game becomes trial and error.  The game allows you to look ahead into the level to plan out a strategy but specifically area 4 makes this feature useless because of bullets suddenly appearing out of the fog.  So while you can plan out a strategy for the enemies ahead, you can't forsee the sudden bullets.

The controls, graphics, music, sound effects are all standard.  Nothing special, but the game is consistent in maintaing its cute theme.

I don't want to give the game a thumbs up or a thumbs down.  The reason being is because there's only a few select I would recommend this game to.  If you like FPS games and difficult games, you may find this game enjoyable.  If not you probably won't like this game because it doesn't have much to offer other than the game itself and online leaderboards.  And so once you reach your skill cap and have not completed the game yet, it begins getting frustrating.

Achievement hunters:  I 100% this game in 18h (including idle time) and used a guide.  It is difficult but not impossible (don't give up!!).  DON'T BE A PLEB AND USE THE CHEAT ENGINE YOU MONKEYS.

I don't know how write a review so here's a comparison of pros and cons between. CoD:AW vs Lovely Planet.


CoD:AW

You either can't connect to the servers, or you can't find a match.

Pros:
+ Fast paced.
+ Lots of customization.
+ Graphics and Audio were decent enough.
+ Every 12 year old that plays this game has banged your mom.
+ Uninstall worked like a charm.

Cons:
- No Dedicated servers.
- Host gets an advantage everytime.
- Shit hitreg.
- Connection issues.
- Can't play if AW services are down.
- 59.99€ for the game.
- 199,57€ for all DLCs.
- Futuristic guns that shoot lasers that nobody asked for.
- Most of the customization you have to buy.
- Extremely fast prestige progression.
- Garbage optimisation.
- No games found.
- No servers list.
- Unbalanced.


Lovely Planet

You go around shooting vegetables that are either carrots or tomatoes (that did nothing wrong and are only fighting back because of self-defense) with your futuristic gun that erases them from their existance completely.

Pros:
+ Requires skill and patience.
+ Extremelly well paced.
+ Over 9k FPS.
+ More playtime than No Man's Lie.
+ Replayable.
+ Music is a'ight.
+ Excellent movement.
+ 5,99€ for the game.
+ Gets you to Global Elite in CS:GO in no time.
~ No Crosshair.

Cons:
- The title is misleading because this game is hardcore as fuck and has a NC-17 rating.
- You can only murder red vegetables and not blue, which is a bit racist.

24973933.review:
这款游戏叫做《可爱星球》，小清新反差色调FPS半技术向游戏。

从进入的主界面和字体就把我吸引了，糖果苏打向清新画风，选择界面是3D的，并且可以通过移动鼠标来轻微转换移动视角，创意不错。进入游戏后，让我觉得眼前一亮的就是BGM，配合游戏界面会让游戏性提升了不止一点，而且还百听不腻的喵。

玩法是通过消灭所有怪物，达到传送点即可胜利，怪物以及粉红色的东西都不能碰的。主角使用的武器是一根法杖，可以无限发炮，发炮无间隔cd，也就是说你手速有多快就能发射的多快，但是多了也没用，怪物都是一击毙命的。作为FPS却没有准星瞄准，这让得不少手残党叫苦，甚至很多人都在屏幕中央画上了“准星”.....其实没有准星这个设定非常的好，考验的就是玩家对准星的脑补，对于在cs上练过盲狙的猫某来说，虽不是什么大神，但与怪相距八九步的距离完全可以弹无虚发一击一准，当然，这不是天生的，需要磨练才能有成果的。游戏关卡很多，而且越来越难，后面出现的怪物发射弹幕的频率加快，并且会飞行，目标也变的很小；还有一种苹果陷阱，抛起的苹果必须打爆才行，否则落地算这一关失败。所以总体来说，是一款半技术向的FPS游戏。

若满分是10分的话，个人给这个游戏打下分：

    [tr]
        [th]项目[/th]
        [th]评分[/th]

    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]游戏性[/td]

    [/tr]
    [tr]

        [td]9分[/td]
    [/tr]

        [td]10分[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]综合评定[/td]
        [td]9分[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

遇到的bug：在建筑顶端和丘陵等高地势的地方跳跃并降落，不会触发苹果陷阱弹射，经测试发现，苹果陷阱触发判定应该是在正确道行进路上的一片平面区域，这个设定不合理，希望开发者能够将判定范围改成以苹果陷阱为中心的一片球形区域判定触发就好了。

24754976.review:
Lovely Planet, where to begin. I received Lovely Planet for free during a PC Gamer giveaway and it proceeded to haunt my dreams for two weeks. While I'm sure it can be enjoyed as a casual FPS to pass the time my approach was different. I'm by no means a speed runner, and in fact probably only hold two top 100 times in this game. However be warned, if you approach this game looking for a nice easy 100% you'll be very disappointed. The path to 100% seems simple and easy in the first three worlds but come world four you may be rethinking your decision. World five is another beast entirely. That said mastering a level after an hour of work and receiving all three stars- one for completing the level, one for 100% accuracy on the level, and one for beating the levels par time- is a fantastic feeling which is only comparable to showing that stupid Bed of Chaos who's b0ss in Dark Souls. 100%'ing Lovely Planet is my proudest achievement on Steam to date, but the journey isn't for everyone.

Pros:
Level design
Responsive controls
Late game difficulty
Soundtrack (at first)
Achievements

Cons:
Glitched leaderboards
Soundtrack (You'll hate it eventually)

7.5/10

24726789.review:
Table of Contents:
- Foreword
- Graphics
- Gameplay
- Sounds
- Controls
- Quality
- Overall Experience


-Foreword
I saw some gameplay of that game a year ago, it looked weird to me.
Well, its way more fun to play than watching videos (which is not the case in other Singleplayer games for me).

-Graphics
Obviously you can notice that the graphic detail isnt really insanely advanced, i really enjoy the style though.

-Gameplay
I really enjoyed the gameplay. It gets more challenging over time and i had much fun trying to beat levels on all three stars.

-Sounds
The music was amazing! I rarely hear such good music in games.

-Controls
The controls are pretty easy to learn, but hard to master. I can definetly recommend using a lower mouse sensitivity for higher accuracy. There is no crosshair which makes it harder to hit "enemies" (which is not a bad thing at all)

-Quality
I've not noticed any bugs or anything at all. The game runs flawless

-Overall Experience
I had much fun playing that game so far, and i will probably have in the future too!
I can defiently recommend getting that game, especially if its on sale!

24561226.review:
Created by a madman from Hell, lovely planet is a gore-filled massacre of a shooter, far superior to games like doom. You shoot skulls of the deceased at the rotting flesh of demons. With a silenced blood covered assault rifle. Even with the limited amount of playtime i have it was obvious that this game would be a challenge and would require the fastest reflexes. Luckily, i trained for 8 years in a Mongolian monastery to gain the fastest wrists, so this wasn't too much of a challenge for me. 

The main enemy is a man/woman by the name of smoth, a sickened, cruel individual who has mastered these burning lands and has come to lead them. Their reign extends to the farthest reach of this game's universe and is ever apparent at the end of each level. 

Luckily though, this game has (the equivalent of) pyrovision to prevent post traumatic stress disorder amongst it's players.  But the original theme is still very apparent. You save the innocents, all of which were misguided and enslaved  as you attempt to restore order to the world. 

This is, in all seriousness, a developer to keep an eye on. In the short amount of time i've played i can already see the upcoming challenge of the game.

24460754.review:
Simplesmente um dos melhores jogos já feitos da historia, senão o melhor jogo já feito até agora. Um FPS com uma historia illuminati marcante, gráficos de ponta e totalmente homenageando o Brasil. Essa análise vai ter spoilers, então veja por vc msm. 

O jogo se passa no Brasil (o jogo não fala, mas as fases são todas verdes, amarelas e azuis, o que significa que é o Brasil, a arte japonesa significa que o jogo foi feito por um otaku) onde o Brasil vive um mundo de paz e tranquilidade, onde a população (representada por blocos pretos) está sofrendo um grave perigo dos comunistas (representado por blocos vermelhos e outras formas geométricas) e você não é nada mais do que Augusto Lima, o lendário patriota caçador de comunistas que precisa livrar do Brasil da ameaça vermelha

As fases são rápidas, o desenvolvedor foi esperto em colocar vários tipos de comunistas para serem mortos pelo jogador, e são posicionados em locais estratégios para testar suas habilidades de patriotas, entretanto os comunistas pegaram alguns reféns e usam eles contra você [spoiler](Comunistas filhos da puta!)[/spoiler] e você precisa tomar cuidado para não acertar os outros patriotas negros (afinal, somos todos macacos).

A jogabilidade é ótima, Augusto consegue correr super rápido e tem em sua mão a sua arma patriota que mata os comunistas com um só tiro, mas você também morre com um só tiro (o jogo é realista). 

Enfim, recomendadissímo para quem é Patriota!!!

24443154.review:
The music is great, hands down the best part of the game. Kudos to the music guy Calum Bowen.

The game itself... isn't all that great.

The graphics need some more baking, even for a budget Katamari Damacy / Nobi Nobi tribute.
There are some lazy-looking particle effects and there are great differences in the level of graphic detail during gameplay (the tiny purple stars and Japanese phrases vs. the huge featureless terrain), which gives the game a heterogeneous look (in a bad way).

There are hours of content, but the level design is haphazard and at times unintuitive. I would have rather had a shorter game with levels that had more care put into them.

Also, for those looking for a competitive game, I hope hacked leaderboards don't stop you from enjoying a game (at the time of writing, this game has them). Being about shooting while moving, it's also sorely missing a crosshair, which should have at least been included as an option.

If you choose to play it, here's two pieces of advice:
1. Turn the SFX off. The SFX consist of lazy, tacky sounds that don't do the music any justice. You lose the tell for the apples being tossed, but it's still worth the awesome (uninterrupted) music.
2. If you find the shooting enemies annoying, know that you can kill them by hitting any of their bullets (bug or feature?).

Overall, I still think it's a decent game, just not for $6. I'd say grab it on sale if you know what you're getting into, and even then only bother if you like the OST.

24408487.review:
Although I got this game for free in the BundleStars giveaway, I am planning on buying the game for friends. This game is incredible for people who have played FPS games for a while on PC. You can truly test your movement, aiming, timing and puzzle skills because believe it or not, this game's got it all.

The game is split up into five worlds, with a varying amount of levels in each world. You'll be getting around 90 levels with individual leaderboards for Global, Friends and Your own scores. If you have a group of friends who love to be competitive, you could have a semi-multiplayer experience, with that one guy getting like 2 seconds ahead of everyone else's times and nobody knowing how.

The idea of the game is to shoot the red box people, which the game refers to as 'baddies'. Once all of them have been defeated, you need to walk into a purple pole to submit your time. The major point of this game for me is how although there is a set out route for general play, there are many shortcuts that you can find. Some are massive whereas some may only shave 0.5 seconds. It's a gold mine for competitive players who want to best their friends. The only rules in this game are that you start at [i]x[/i] and you need to reach [i]y[/i] having defeated the baddies.

For not even £5, this game is worth it. It took me approximately 10 hours or so to 100% the game, but with leaderboards, if you're serious enough to try topping them you could spend much more time than me on it. I don't know how people who class themselves as 'casual' fps players would handle this game, as World 4 and 5 get pretty intense and can also get quite frustrating.

The game has a 3 Star rating system. The three stars are Blue, Green and Yellow/Gold which are obtained through:
Blue - Shooting all the baddies and completing the level.
Green - Clearing the level quickly.
Yellow/Gold - And achieving 100% accuracy.

Although you can achieve all 3 stars in one run, you [b]don't[/b] need to in order to 100% the level. You can run through it with bad accuracy in order to get a good time for green, then run it again much slower to achieve the yellow/gold star for accuracy.

If I'm not mistaken, when you get a time on the leaderboard and you didn't get all the stars, next to your name you will have a square. However if you get all the stars, your square will be a star shape instead, showing everyone who sees you on the leaderboard as having achieved 100% accuracy along with your good time.

Even if you were casually picking up this game, it's a good way to improve at many things you would need to improve at other FPS.

If I had one [b]complaint[/b], it's about how if you walk too close to an edge, instead of walking off it, you walk down it, causing yourself to screw up a jump and potentially end a nice time.

24369059.review:
Abundant with Japanese text and whimsically oversized bric-a-brac, the nonsense world of Lovely Planet could easily be mistaken for the
latest project from Katamari creator Keita Takahashi. Indeed, as a homage to the Japanese director’s work it is reverential to the point of plagiarism, complete with his trademark pastel colours, a nefariously catchy soundtrack and a font lifted straight from Noby Noby Boy. As it turns out, this initial ruse is just the first of the many traps and pranks that developer Quicktequila has gleefully threaded throughout Lovely Planet, constituting a debut effort that loves nothing more than to make a complete fool of the player time and time again. Be it a slyly hidden enemy or that moment when, mid jump, a fatal patch of goo conveniently slips right under your feet moments before you touch the ground, one thing’s for sure: Lovely Planet doesn’t let you get comfy.

It’s not that the game’s particularly complicated. On the contrary, Lovely Planet is about as rudimentary a first person shooter as you’re likely to find in 2014, its blocky geometry and utter dismissal of narrative ambitions rounding off what is essentially a back to basics re-evaluation of the genre. Restricting the player’s abilities to running, jumping and shooting, the game thrusts the mechanical core of first-person shooters to the centre of the agenda, cutting straight to the pavlovian delight of squeezing a digital trigger and amplifying it through increasingly frantic and difficult challenges. Unlike most modern video games which introduce perks, upgrades and additional abilities as the game unfolds, Lovely Planet equips the player with all the tools they’ll need at the get go, consecrating the player’s raw skill as the sole means and measure of their progress. As such, there’s no back doors when it comes to the more challenging levels – it’s a case of get good or give up. This axiom holds true not just across the game’s hundred or so stages but also at the level of individual enemy encounters. Players scarcely have more than a few milliseconds in which to eliminate targets and in later sections of the game, each of these small victories is swiftly interrupted by another incoming missile or deviously placed obstacle. Such hostility affords very little room for improvisation, fostering a highly prescriptive style of play in which just one correct approach to each level seems possible: some levels might as well include a driving line of the likes seen in Forza or Gran Turismo given the dearth of wiggle room available. Thus, Lovely Planet often plays like a puzzle game, the player fumbling towards each level’s “solution” – jump there, shoot that enemy first, then dodge that bullet, etc – through trial and error.

It is in this sense that this cutesy, ostensibly kid-friendly shooter is actually a close relative of Dark Souls, both games offering experiences characterised by copious rehearsal and meticulous execution, not to mention crippling difficulty. But where the layers of complexity in Dark Souls afford the player a certain amount of agency – be it through the choice of weapons, experience point allocation or class selection – Lovely Planet is significantly more restrictive. In some ways this works to the game’s advantage: with just one variable to consider, it’s always clear to the player that their own physical ability is the only barrier to success, making for a more accessible experience than navigating the many esoteric and ambiguous systems which notoriously turn newcomers off Dark Souls. By the same token, however, Lovely Planet is also a less mentally stimulating affair. From Software’s game teaches the virtues of patience and critical play, prompting players to continually question and re-evaluate their approach in response to the situation at hand, cautiously attending to a multitude of competing factors. They become unstuck not through brute force repetition but by examining every angle of the problem until something clicks, reaching a bespoke solution all their own. In Lovely Planet however, there is little mystery about how a level should be beaten, with enemies often approaching you head on or placed helpfully within your immediate line of sight. Thus, the player’s only option then is to run through the level over and over, until finally they perform each step of the developer’s dance with absolute precision. As with real life choreography, the end product is often breathtaking, and with enough practice the player can find themselves pirouetting through levels, dispatching foes with delicate touch of a virtuoso. But such flawless runs are possible only after long sessions of arduous repetition, and at the point when the player’s interaction with the game has become entirely automated. Simply put: where Dark Souls is a mindful experience, Lovely Planet is often a mindless one.

As difficult and repetitious as Lovely Planet gets however, rarely is it frustrating. It’s hard to hold a grudge against a game so whimsical,
especially when it delivers even the most nefarious of its tricks with such stone-faced innocence. Indeed, it’s the wealth of charm exuded throughout Lovely Planet in tandem with its highly simplified mechanics that solidify it as a thoroughly accessible introduction to the “masocore” genre, capturing the cathartic rush of accomplishment that draws players to such punishing games while avoiding the usual dark imagery and reams of potentially overwhelming minutiae. Indeed, it’s dichotomies like this that define Lovely Planet – the balance of frustration and satisfaction, the interplay of skill and memory, the cuddly visuals disguising hardcore difficulty – and hence amount to an inevitably polarising experience. While the ecstatic hit of finishing a particularly tricky level is certainly satisfying, whether such fleeting contentment is worth all the preceding effort will vary from player to player, as will the entertainment value of a experience which relies so much upon repetition. Still, players will undergo a very palpable sense of growth, able to pull of feats of skill seemingly impossible when just starting out. Whether or not this transformation carries any meaning outside of the game itself is debatable, but more important is the feeling it evokes, coating Lovely Planet with a sugary sweet sprinkling of gratification that some will find hard to resist.

24346384.review:
steam上第一个差评
不要被特别好评的表象迷惑了，这是一款只值得免费领来挂卡的游戏，除此之外不值得花一分钱和一秒钟
0.9个小时的体验简直就是一场噩梦，你可以感受到开发者的恶意以及嘲讽:辣鸡，看我不玩死你。
只玩了三章就受不了了，谈谈我的体验：
第一章还好，第二章就是噩梦的开始，第三章则是另一场噩梦的开始
第二章加入了一个苹果（？）的设定，它会在你到达特定的地方后弹起，只要它落下你就死了，也就是你要在移动和跳跃中，一边躲避怪物的子弹一边想办法打掉这个该死的苹果，难以形容这种体验
PS：最恶心的是用来跳跃的平台竟然可以被子弹打掉，无数次在疯狂扫射希望打掉苹果时不小心打掉前面的平台，然后重来
第三章去掉了苹果（应该是这样，只玩了前面几关），但是加入了种新怪物，而它的子弹会追踪，呵呵，真TM好玩
哦，对了，这游戏是通过计时来打分的，还会计算你的射击准确度，另外不能漏掉一只怪物，我只能对这个辣鸡比个中指。

At first glance, this game looks like a nice, relaxing, cutesy little thing. Don't let the looks decieve you. You will come to hate everything around you, from the flying apples to the "friendly" blocks. It requires a mixture of precise aim and timing skills, and most levels will take several tries to get right. 

 [h1]Pros[/h1]
+Fun gameplay
+Challenging
+Nice aesthetic
+Runs well on any computer
+Great soundtrack
+Feels awesome to beat a level, especially with high accuracy
+Lots of levels to play

[h1]Cons[/h1]
-Can be frustrating after awhile
-Sometimes is glitchy
-Gets repetitive after a play session of ~20-30 minutes (especially when you have to do the same level over and over)

Hands down the best free Steam key I've gotten. I wouldn't mind spending money on this at all, and I'd definitely have to recommend it to anyone who's interested.

Got this for free, but I love it more than any game I've bought in months. If you like shooters and platformers, and you've ever enjoyed a speedrunner, I'm sure you'll love it too!

Pros:
- Kawaii, good looking
- Perfect difficulty curve
- Has interesting+fun mechanics (shoot an enemy's bullet to kill them!)
- Varied and professional level design
- Good UI and instantaneous level resetting
- Great, fun music

Cons:
- No reticle. The mechanics and level design make it so you rarely need to shoot things far away until much later levels, so you have time to get used to it. Still wish there were an option for it.

24326139.review:
Lovely Planet, a game set in hell, with little triangles played by imps and cubes played by demons. The shots those cubes fire at you can be frustrating, but nothing is worse than [i] the apples.	[/i] The apples fly up into the air, sometimes with direction, and if they come crashing down, then you go crashing down with them. So, the obvious solution is to murder them as fast as you can. However, one day, you come across an apple who doesn't launch, and immediately you know what's to come... As you realize you have to jump, turn around, and shoot the apple mid-air, and your obvious solution is not so obvious anymore, you decide that there is a better way to end this, and with your strange star gun, you commit suicide.

You reopen your eyes, and next to you lies your gun, and in front of you a red triangle. After all, committing suicide sends you to hell.

24320975.review:
Описание:
Аркадный шутер в мире пацифизма. Мы переносимся в красочный мимимишный мир, наполненный милюсенькими фонами, где растут красивые цветочки, летают мягенькие платформы и водятся монстрики-симпатюлички. Мы вооружены красивой палочкой, которая стреляет зарядами счастья и радости, которых в свою очередь очень боятся монстрики. Нашей задачей будет добраться от точки респауна до финишного флажка, попутно расстреляв всех монстриков и это все в строго ограниченное время. Несколько миров, множество уровней и невероятно много попыток пройти каждый уровень идеально.

Плюсы:
¥ Красивый радужный мир, где переплетаются светлые, теплые краски.
¥ Пацифизм - как же приятно иногда взять в руки не пулемет, а волшебную палочку и побегать без кучи разорванных кишек по экрану.
¥ Приятная музыка.
¥ Множество скрытых интересных мест (а к ним еще и достижения привязаны).
¥ Хардкор - пройти уровень нужно за короткое время, при этом убить всех монстров и самому не умереть (а умираем мы с одного тычка).
¥ Интересные достижения - поиск скрытых мест, прохождение всех уровней на три звезды (а это хардкорно втройне).
¥ Возможность постепенно зарабатывать звезды (пройти уровень можно на три звезды) - тоесть мы можем сначала пробежать максимально быстро, а затем допустим попасть всеми пулями в цель и тп.

Минусы:
¥ Уровни устроены так, что их нужно заучивать наизусть. Иначе мы получить три звезды будет просто нереально.
¥ Нет русского языка (а перевести нужно было только меню, так, что смело можно играть даже не имея совершенно никаких знаний).

Достижения:
Достижения в игре получить довольно трудно, но зато интересно. Для этого нужно пройти все уровни на три звезды, найти все скрытые локации и сделать еще несколько мелочей.

Итог:
Хорошая и милая игра, которая вроде должна расслаблять... Но после нескольких уровней хочется разбить как клавиатуру так и мышь. Игра очень динамична и заставляет щелкать пальцами и шевелить мозгом... Рекомендую принимать небольшими порциями.

Оценка: 6/10

24311703.review: If you replace every instance of "lovely" in this game with "difficult and frustrating on so many levels" you get Lovely Planet. Lovely Planet is a non-traditional take on a first-person shooter. It takes place in bright and colourful environments with a fantastic soundtrack. This game feels so good. The jumping, the shooting, just plays so smooth. This game is a million times better with a controller. This is an EXTREMELY hard game and I ended up breaking an Xbox Controller, but in the end, I grabbed another controller and came back for more. It might just be me but I ended up spending 40 MINUTES!!! on one level. This game is just so addictive. I mean, when I first went to play this game, I thought I had some serious issues, but I played it anyway (being the daring guy I am) and....well.....2 and a half hours in and I ended up taking my laptop IN THE CAR with me when I was going on a short car trip. I played this game. I punched everything. I hid myself in my bedroom for 3 days. I didn't wanna speak to anyone. A game like that, has to have some sort of emotive to draw me in sooooooo, thumbs up I guess :)

24285270.review:
[i]Lovely Planet[/i] shows an FPS can be simple and fun! The levels are colorful and low poly as well as the enemies and obstacles. I think the game's huge downfall is the awkward aiming and lack of even a crosshair that could be helpful when obtaining rewards for completing a level perfectly. Also, on a few levels I didn't understand why I constantly was losing as dying or failing a level restarts the level immediately without delay or explaination. Regardless, I found myself replaying levels over and over to attempt to get a perfect score while getting terribly frusterated doing it. The game's music is very upbeat and enjoyable to listen to, perhaps to cheer you up after dying for the gazillionth time to some stray purple cube flying at you. Overall, I had a lovely time playing [i]Lovely Planet[/i] but I really feel a crosshair would improve the game immensely. I've noticed quite a few people put a sticky note on their monitor to fix this as well. I'd rather the sticky note be included in the game though others have said they enjoy the extra challenge. To each their own I suppose.

Overall : ★ ★ ★ ☆ ☆

1 minute in and I'm already having fun in this fast pased quirky shooter game. Don't be fooled by it's graphics, it's actually very difficult and extremely competitive amongst other players.

This game is really simple with one goal, one weapon, but with various obstacles to get passed as you try to beat levels as fast as you can.

I'm more of a slow pased gamer myself and although this game is extremely fast pased I'd recommend it to any player out there (especially any fast pased competitive FPS players out there). This game is also very easy to learn causing most players to pick this up in no time and also making it a great title for children.

The only complaint I have is the menu system as i think it could use some improvements: I felt a bit lost in the menu when I first started the game, causing me to click a few random buttons until executed a command as it isn't exactly your common, straight forward list of options which most games provide you with as you start playing. Nonetheless, I highly recommend this game to all who are reading. :)

The weapon is a crap crossbow that you shoot love into the enemies, not death. I am all for people being happy. Go get married be gay be happy, but this game is the equivalent of two guys coming to my house and showing me what they do in their spare time. Keep it private and I am fine with it. This is a super fast shooter where the point is to clear each stage and be the top on the leader boards worldwide. If I had actually accidentally gotten onto the top ten display for any of the levels I would pay to have my name removed. The enemies suck, the weapons suck, the levels suck, all because it looks like a game for the gayest of the gay, or for a two year old. There really is nothing more here to say as far as the game goes, just a really dumb waste of time game that couldn't be fun even in hell.

Look closely at most games and you will see that just because a game has mostly positive user reviews does not mean that it is actually a good game. This is true for a lot of games now that have mostly good user reviews. This isn't even funny-bad, it is just homeless guy laying in his own p-ss in the gutter sad. And gay. Big time.

9/10. Ten billion, that is.

23849392.review: Given the very quit and monotone nature of this game's trailer, coupled with another one with a more joyful background music, I went into this game thinking it would be a very calming, casual experience. Everywhere from the art design and the simpistic gameplay reflects such an assumption, if you allow the game to be a relaxing experience. It's a  fun game, but the emphasis on accuracy and time can make you choose to make "Lovely Planet" a very competitive journey. After a while, I decided to shoot for the fastest time and complete a stage without missing a shot, and I found such a decision to be much more enjoyable and rewarding. If you want to take it more slow and be casual with the game, this is the perfect title for such a goal. If you want to be more competitve, this also fulfills such a desire.

23805299.review:
Bien que je n'ai pas passé beaucoup de temps dessus, j'ai trouvé Lovely Planet... ben, lovely en effet. :) 

C'est un hybrique "fps" et "plateformer" proposant un gameplay satisfaisant, et une DA rafraîchissante. 
Celle-ci est en effet très colorée (et aussi assez simpliste, limite enfantine), rendant le jeu visuellement très apaisant. Les musiques sont sympa, particulièrement celle de la Z1 qui rythme bien les runs !
Question gp, les aspects tirs comme mouvement sont très réactifs et le jeu propose des niveau à réussir, si l'on veut les trois étoiles (max score de chaque niveau) tant sur le chrono que sur la précision des tirs, motivant la personne derrière le clavier à refaire ceux-ci pour connaître les recoin et les bons timing. Les retours (feedback) visuels et sonores du jeu sont très bien faits et donnent les alertes qui vont bien. 

Un chouette jeu qui vaut même un court détour. :)

23320501.review: A snappy precision-based platformer that really tests your reaction times (and patience, as is with many games I tend to enjoy)! Levels are relatively short with plenty of opportunity to boost your scores, but the global scoreboard itself has been totally hijacked by... well, certainly not human times. The soundtrack is upbeat and I even tend to listen to it daily, the graphics have a comfy almost comparably \"Katamari\" feel. Of course, with any game like this, you have objectives and such; but there\'s also an element of exploration with the creative floaty courses (finding all sorts of secrets and oddities nets you some achievements as well as a sense of \"I explored that!\"). Overall I could recommend it to anyone looking for a quick pick-up and play type of game with lots of practice for payoff ^-^

23234101.review: Green ,blue ,yellow and red bands swirl across the surface of the planet hovering menacingly in the dsitance. My firearm is ready, extended from me like some newly formed limb with the sole purpose of reigning hateful death and anguish on my enemies. I'm alone. Sweat drips into my eyelids, the salt stings and blinds me. The bowel quivering fear I have known till now slowly evapourates ,replaced by a grim purpose. I will not live beyond the next few minutes which will stretch out for what seems like hours in an adrenaline fuelled kill frenzy, every fibre of my being attuned to the death reigning around me in this foreign land. Don't think of home. There is only cold death here. I step out into the unknown, hot red projectiles spew from my weapon like bright magma from an ancient eruption. I see their faces grim and emotionless as I mow them down mercilessly. Do they know heaven? Will we sit at the top of a great viking banquet together after death, united as soldiers ,now brought together by the common horror that only a warrior can know? Or will the battle continue forever in the after life ,our endless hell set to repeat ad-infinitum. A distant thud.The unmistakable sound chills me to the bone. I look to the horizon while spraying ammunition across the battlefield. My worst fear confirmed. An apple. A FUCKING APPLE. Thud. another. JESUS GOD NO!! TWO APPLES !!! I die and awake to a fresh hell. Haunted by merciless apples I weep. Why would any God allow apples to exist.

So,  you're like me. A guy who takes a  interest in a funny Japanese looking game called lovely planet. Apparently the game is not at all as it seems. 

It starts out with some light run and gun shooting over some fluffy music and animation. But at world 2 (close to world 3) the game starts to show it's True colors. The game is hard, very hard and not in the good way. I'm no stranger to frustrating games but this One Just seems unfair.  The point of hard games is to overcome the difficulty and feel like you have achieved something. But lovely planet becomes annoying. My main reasons for this are the bombs and the lack of crosshairs. 

Trying not to go into to much detail, bombs are flying fruit that end the level if you don't shoot them before they touch the ground. A lot of the time the game will throw bombs at you out of nowhere and flustered you aim and shoot them. Although alot of the time you will miss. Not due to your lack of skill but because you had no idea where to aim

What I'm trying to say is the game kills you in one hit and the difficulty because frustrating due to the lack of crosshair and One hit kill mechanics.
Tl:dr if you are into hard games maybe give it a try but if you are looking for something light don't try this game

22102487.review:
来来来，有多少人是这冲着很漂亮的汉字成就而入此游戏的！让我看到你们的举起来的手！
但是重要的事写在前面！该作来自霓虹国，大家千万不能被游戏萌萌哒的画风和配乐给蒙蔽了！
此游戏的难度属性极度不！友！好！不要说什么全成就了，单谈满星通关和秘密收集齐全就难到丧心病狂令人发指！
入坑之前请各位好好想想自己玩第一视角操作类型的游戏的情况用来参考。
如果没有一颗标准受虐狂的炽热的心的话不建议新人“随地入坑”。
常规的走位手法和瞄点技术可以慢慢练出来，然而没有预测弹道轨迹的“心灵感应”能力在游戏中就会举步维艰了。毕竟第一视角射击游戏中“感觉”这玩意儿是一门玄学！没法儿练！靠的是天赋，靠的是与生俱来的手感.......
前期和中期本人独立完成了可以获取的成就，感觉整个人晕眩的要吐了！到了收集秘密成就差两个关卡的时候卡住了！难度好像提升了一个次元一样！是抱了另一个大触小伙伴的大腿才通关达成相应成就的！过程是那么的励志辛酸结果才会显得愈发的甜美！
游戏并不是无脑的突突突，必须要把所有敌人消灭并且到达目标点才算过关，没有任何捷径可以走。想要满星还必须满足规定时间通关和每一个子弹都消灭一个敌人击杀率100%的这两个附加条件。五个世界，100+张地图，无数的机关.....游戏评分7.5/10（因！为！太！难！了！）
勇士们！我们的征途是星尘大海（石沉大海）！頑張って！

Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Platform shooter game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There are many video settings.
You can play the game in fullscreen or window mode
There is a music slide bar. It changes in 10% everytime.
It doesn't have a sound slide bar. So you can't change the sound volume. Which is stupid.
You can play with the xbox controller.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

You have to jump across the current level and shooting the "baddies". You have to kill all of the baddies in order the complete the level.  If you miss one, you are forced to redo the level again. The water balloons are an instant death when it lands on the ground.  Even if you are not close to it or near. You will still die instantly. If you hit the black cube, you will have to restart the level again. I don't think this game is worth purchasing the full price. Unless you like "classic" casual games.  

You don't have access to the options when ingame.
The graphics are terrible.
There is a small ingame tutorial.
There is a leaderboards but who cares about those.
Music is cartoony and WAY TOO HAPPY FOR MY EARS.
There is no lifebar. however you do die in 1 hit.
If you have hit an enemy then your weapon will glow.
You have the option to look ahead. So that you know what is coming your way.
There are secrets.
There are many worlds and levels. i think each world has 20 levels.

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

There are chinese language sometimes in the game. Which is not needed.
This is a game for kids. That is for sure.
It's stupid that they let you show the leaderboards everytime you play a level. Even if you have died and you are restarting the level again. This is really annoying after awhile.
The game is also somewhat Time challenged based....
How can the game be lovely if you are killing things.
The difficulty wll be increased at level 2 already. 

-------------------

I Give this game a 3/10

21638507.review:
かわいい見た目をしているが中身はかなり高難易度のトライアル＆エラー型スピードランニングFPS。
ストーリーは皆無でネタバレを気にするようなゲームではないので、どんなのか見てみたい人はガイドあたりから★３（クリア、タイム、命中率）動画を見てみると良い。
「それ実績用の特殊なプレイでしょ？」と思われるかもしれないが、実際やってみるとレベルの構造上ほぼ変わらないプレイを要求される（特に後半はそうするしか選択肢が無い）。

操作感は一般的なFPSと同じだ。動作応答・空中制御も優秀で、変な慣性も無い。しかしcrosshairが無いのでAIMは体で覚える必要がある。
ちなみにcrosshairが無いのは意地悪ではなく意味が無いから（自身の動きにより弾は画面の中心を手前から奥へ向かって真っ直ぐ飛ぶわけではないから）だそうだ。
移動中に発射すると弾に多少のドリフトはかかるが、通常はそこまで気にする程ではない。

総じてこれはFPSの腕試しだ。腕に覚えのある人は挑戦してもらいたい（ちなみに私は完全クリアに１２時間かかった）。
そうでない人にはまったくオススメしない。あっという間に詰むだろう。

21580443.review:
This is a cute platformer with a little bit of a magic wand thing that you can shoot polygons with.

It's themed like something a little schoolgirl would like, I guess if you are a little schoolgirl and you don't like complex or realistic graphics, or themes where Hello Kitty wouldn't feel comfortable, then this could well be the game for you.

Pros: It's playable, runs well, could even be fun if you really like 3D platformers and never heard about Nintendo.  There's even a couple of graphics options that allow the game to scale.  It's got a unique theme and artistic direction.

Cons: Nintendo covers this genre way better.   There's not much to the game.  The theme and artistic direction aren't really aimed at PC gamers, it really is something for little schoolgirls or people overdosing on Prozac (call the poisons helpline for medical advice and stop playing computer games with lovehearts all through them). 

It's worth noting it's a tough decision to drop a thumbs down on this one - the developers did achieve what they set out to do, the technical execution was solid enough.   It's just not everyone's cup of tea.   In fact, almost nobodys cup of tea.

If it helps, imagine the thumbs down has a big love heart next to it.

20594262.review:
Lovely Planet is a very simple platformer-fps game in which the aim is to reach the end pole after having killed all the enemies. It is a very simple goal and it's a very simple game.

But lovely planet is not without its depth and complexity, the game starts off very simple and quickly ramps up the difficulty, with the later levels (at least in my case) requiring you to learn patterns and make multiple attempts. With my current playtime I've finished 4/5 of the worlds avaliable, with the last world looking like it will take a long time to finish.

The movement is also very simple, but feels very clean and responsive overall. You can rampage through the levels spraying purple pellets across the map, but you won't be able to get the highest rating of three stars. Which reqiures both a quick time and a perfect accuracy rating, overall doing a level with three starts feels very crisp and skillful to pull off, especially on some of the harder and longer levels.

I would strongly reccomend this game to fans of similarily hard platforming games like Super Meat Boy or Dustforce, you are forced to get better quickly in Lovely Planet as you are with these games.

Another thing I didn't see in other reviews is that the game has a good competetive and speedrunning scene if you are the kind of person drawn to that, chasing the perfect indivual level time is also very fun, I found myself going back to the earlier levels which I now find trivial simply to do them better than I did before. The gameplay is just that fun.

20538898.review:
The comparison below to Super Meat Boy isn't unfair considering its trial and error gameplay - that isn't frustrating thanks to 1) a fun world with a really particular japanese cutsey pop influenced aesthetic 2) incredibly short levels. But where it really differs (I mean apart from the whole third dimension & shooting bit) is that it is incredibly flexible. It doesn't establish nearly as much structure in terms of how the level will be played. It suggests a simple path for you but gives you quite a lot of freedom to play the game how you'd like to. Sort of a cross between SMB & something more chaotic that still requires finesse and places a greater emphasis on reactionary rather than time based interaction. Which I do like. You set the pace of the game rather than having to wait for the game.

I feel like if I had this game in school I would have spent a lot of time with it. Not so much interested in mechanical perfection these days!

20135636.review:
Lovely Planet is a surprisingly good FPS game that is practically made for hardcore speedunning perfectionists. The levels in this game are meant to be played multiple times until you are happy with a resulting time, making it perfect for the "individual level," or IL speedrunners out there. Craftier individuals might even find themselves spending time creating their own routes to complete the levels even quicker with a higher degree of efficiency. If you aren't a speedrunner, you might find the gameplay difficult to get into as each level (apart from the first few) will require a high level of dedication and time in order to finish. Despite that, I think it is safe to say that every player will enjoy the game's cute graphics and wonderful music. 

Lovely Planet is one of those games that gives you exactly what you expect; you will go into this game knowing whether you are going to love it or hate it. If the game interests you, the price is cheap enough to warrant a purchase, but otherwise I honestly wouldn't recommend it. This game is clearly for a niche audience, but those who happen to fall into that small group of people will surely find a lot to love here.

Don't be fooled by the cuteness, this isn't your grandma's videogame. 
Only for the twitchy and masochist.

Hyperboles aside, the real challenge of the game is getting a perfect score in each level, which will require you to not miss a single shot, while also beating it as fast as you can.
Other than that, the game is a great and doable FPS shooter that hearkens back to the Quake and Doom days, where you were supposed to be always on the move and fast on your trigger.

The visuals are great, the soundtrack is fantastic.

If you are expecting a story, turn back. This game knows what audience it wants, and it doesnt waste time with plot. You must reach Lovely Planet. Thats it.

What I will say here has all been said before. Primarily - apples ruin the game.

I noticed may critic reviews rated the game as "fair" but the Steam ratings are very positive, so I game this game a try. I enjoyed [i]maybe[/i] the first half of the game. Unfortunately late into world 2 you begin to experience the horror of the apples. If apples touch the ground it's game over and early in the game the apples are within a reasonable distance. By the end of world 2 apples are on the other side of the continent and you are expected to hit them, while either racing the clock or going for pin-point accuracy (if you want 3 stars on a level). Coming fresh from playing Quake and Duke Nukem 3D I was all set for speed running but instant game-over objects too far to even see, let alone shoot, ruined my experience pretty quick. With no crosshair and super floaty controls, the experience is only hindered further.
Pros:
[list]
[*] Nice art style
[*] Speedrun Leaderboards
[*] Fair enough price
[/list]

Cons:
[list]
[*] Instant game-over objects
[*] No clear instructions beyond basic controls
[*] Floaty movement
[*] Levels require memorization and multiple play-throughs
[*] No crosshair for aiming
[*] Apples
[*] Apples
[*] Apples
[/list]
